page.title: 02THE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Church ,as it now stands, is a building the architecture of which is of a composite character. There are portions of it, at the west end, which may probably be assigned to the early part of the twelfth century, iif not an even earlier date. {A Norman column,}forming part of an arcade, and adjoining the present square tower, was discovered during restoration of the church in 1871. The{easternmost window}in the south wall of the church belongs to the period of early pointed architecture. The{east window of the south aisle filled with painted glass in memory of members of the family of Mytton of Penylan, is of the style called Decorated.At the{west end}of this aisle, a similar window, a gift from Mrs. Hayhurst of Ystumcolwyn in memory of the husband, H.H. France Hayhurst
